filmography.title: Somebody Up There Likes Me
filmography.role_description: A tough street kid who rises from a life of crime and prison to become the middleweight boxing champion of the world.
filmography.plot: Biopic of middleweight boxing champion Rocky Graziano, detailing his rise from a life of crime to success in the ring.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Cinematography, Best Art Direction

filmography.title: The Long, Hot Summer
filmography.role_description: A suspected barn-burner and con man who drifts into a small Mississippi town and shakes up the powerful Varner family.
filmography.plot: A con man arrives in a small Southern town and becomes involved with the wealthy, domineering owner of the town.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
filmography.role_description: An alcoholic former high school football star struggling with a leg injury, a troubled marriage, and his father's terminal illness.
filmography.plot: Brick, an alcoholic ex-football player, drinks his days away and resists the affections of his wife. A reunion with his terminal father jogs a host of revelations.

filmography.title: The Young Philadelphians
filmography.role_description: A young, ambitious lawyer who navigates the social and ethical challenges of Philadelphia's high society.
filmography.plot: A young man from the wrong side of the tracks rises to the top of Philadelphia society through his career as a lawyer.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Robert Vaughn)

filmography.title: Exodus
filmography.role_description: A Hagannah commander who leads a group of Jewish immigrants from Cyprus to Palestine to found the state of Israel.
filmography.plot: The theme is the founding of the state of Israel. The action begins on a ship filled with Jewish immigrants bound for Israel who are being off-loaded on Cyprus.

filmography.title: The Hustler
filmography.role_description: A talented but self-destructive pool shark who challenges the legendary Minnesota Fats.
filmography.plot: An up-and-coming pool player plays a long-time champion in a single high-stakes match.

filmography.title: Paris Blues
filmography.role_description: A jazz trombonist living in Paris who must choose between his music and a romance with an American tourist.
filmography.plot: Two jazz musicians in Paris deal with romantic problems and their careers.

filmography.title: Sweet Bird of Youth
filmography.role_description: A drifter and gigolo who returns to his hometown with a faded movie star, hoping to win back his former girlfriend.
filmography.plot: A drifter returns to his hometown with an aging movie star in hopes of getting a movie contract.

filmography.title: Hud
filmography.role_description: An arrogant, self-centered rancher who conflicts with his highly principled father.
filmography.plot: Honest and hard-working Texas rancher Homer Bannon has conflict with his unscrupulous, selfish, arrogant and alcoholic son Hud.

filmography.title: Harper
filmography.role_description: A cool, cynical private investigator hired to find a missing millionaire.
filmography.plot: Private investigator Lew Harper is hired by a wealthy woman to find her missing husband.

filmography.title: Torn Curtain
filmography.role_description: An American physicist who pretends to defect to East Germany to steal a missile formula.
filmography.plot: An American scientist publicly defects to East Germany as part of a cloak-and-dagger mission to find the solution for a formula.

filmography.title: Hombre
filmography.role_description: A white man raised by Apaches who must protect a stagecoach of prejudiced passengers from outlaws.
filmography.plot: John Russell, disdained by his 'respectable' fellow stagecoach passengers because he was raised by Indians, becomes their only hope for survival.

filmography.title: Cool Hand Luke
filmography.role_description: A nonconformist prisoner on a chain gang who refuses to submit to the system's authority.
filmography.plot: A laid-back Southern man is sentenced to two years in a rural prison, but refuses to conform.

filmography.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
filmography.role_description: The charming and clever leader of the Hole-in-the-Wall Gang who flees to Bolivia with his partner.
filmography.plot: Wyoming outlaws Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid get on the wrong side of the law and must go on the run.

filmography.title: The Life and Times of Judge Roy Bean
filmography.role_description: An outlaw who appoints himself the judge of a lawless town in West Texas.
filmography.plot: In Vinegaroon, Texas, former outlaw Roy Bean appoints himself the judge for the region and dispenses his brand of justice.

filmography.title: The Sting
filmography.role_description: A veteran con man who teams up with a younger grifter to pull off a massive con on a mob boss.
filmography.plot: Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con.

filmography.title: The Towering Inferno
filmography.role_description: The architect of a glass skyscraper who must help save trapped guests when a fire breaks out.
filmography.plot: At the opening party of a colossal, but poorly constructed, office building, a massive fire breaks out, threatening to destroy the tower and everyone in it.

filmography.title: Slap Shot
filmography.role_description: The player-coach of a minor league hockey team who encourages violent play to gain popularity.
filmography.plot: A failing ice hockey team finds success with outrageously violent hockey goonery.

filmography.title: Fort Apache, The Bronx
filmography.role_description: A veteran police officer working in a crime-ridden precinct in the South Bronx.
filmography.plot: In the South Bronx, a police precinct becomes a fortress in a neighborhood filled with crime and drug addiction.

filmography.title: Absence of Malice
filmography.role_description: A liquor wholesaler whose life is turned upside down when a reporter writes a story implicating him in a murder investigation.
filmography.plot: When a prosecutor leaks a false story that a liquor warehouse owner is involved in the murder of a union head, the man's life begins to unravel.

filmography.title: The Verdict
filmography.role_description: An alcoholic, washed-up lawyer who takes on a medical malpractice case and finds a chance for redemption.
filmography.plot: A lawyer sees the chance to salvage his career and self-respect by taking a medical malpractice case to trial rather than settling.

filmography.title: The Color of Money
filmography.role_description: A former pool hustler who returns to the game as a mentor to a talented but cocky young player.
filmography.plot: Fast Eddie Felson teaches a cocky but immensely talented protégé the ropes of pool hustling, which in turn inspires him to make an unlikely comeback.

filmography.title: Mr. & Mrs. Bridge
filmography.role_description: A conservative lawyer and patriarch who struggles to connect with his wife and changing family.
filmography.plot: The story of a traditional family living in Kansas City during the 1930s and 40s, and the changes that drift them apart.

filmography.title: Nobody's Fool
filmography.role_description: A spirited, elderly construction worker who tries to connect with his estranged son and grandson.
filmography.plot: A stubborn man past his prime reflects on his life of strict independence and the people he has kept at a distance.

filmography.title: Road to Perdition
filmography.role_description: An Irish mob boss who is forced to turn against his surrogate son to protect his biological one.
filmography.plot: A mob enforcer's son witnesses a murder, forcing him and his father to take to the road, and his father down a path of redemption and revenge.

filmography.title: Cars
filmography.role_description: A retired race car with a mysterious past who mentors the young Lightning McQueen; Newman's final film role.
filmography.plot: A hot-shot race-car named Lightning McQueen gets waylaid in Radiator Springs, where he finds the true meaning of friendship and family.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Animated Feature
